speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: SCENE IV. A street.

speaker: FRIAR LAURENCE
text_entry: Enter BENVOLIO and MERCUTIO

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Where the devil should this Romeo be?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Came he not home to-night?

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Not to his father's; I spoke with his man.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Ah, that same pale hard-hearted wench, that Rosaline.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Torments him so, that he will sure run mad.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Tybalt, the kinsman of old Capulet,

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Hath sent a letter to his father's house.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: A challenge, on my life.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Romeo will answer it.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Any man that can write may answer a letter.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Nay, he will answer the letter's master, how he

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: dares, being dared.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Alas poor Romeo! he is already dead; stabbed with a

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: white wench's black eye; shot through the ear with a

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: love-song; the very pin of his heart cleft with the

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: blind bow-boy's butt-shaft: and is he a man to

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: encounter Tybalt?

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Why, what is Tybalt?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: More than prince of cats, I can tell you. O, he is

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: the courageous captain of compliments. He fights as

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: you sing prick-song, keeps time, distance, and

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: proportion; rests me his minim rest, one, two, and

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: the third in your bosom: the very butcher of a silk

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: button, a duellist, a duellist; a gentleman of the

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: very first house, of the first and second cause:

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: ah, the immortal passado! the punto reverso! the

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: hai!

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: The what?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: The pox of such antic, lisping, affecting

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: fantasticoes; these new tuners of accents! 'By Jesu,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: a very good blade! a very tall man! a very good

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: whore!' Why, is not this a lamentable thing,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: grandsire, that we should be thus afflicted with

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: these strange flies, these fashion-mongers, these

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: perdona-mi's, who stand so much on the new form,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: that they cannot at ease on the old bench? O, their

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: bones, their bones!

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Enter ROMEO

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Here comes Romeo, here comes Romeo.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Without his roe, like a dried herring: flesh, flesh,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: how art thou fishified! Now is he for the numbers

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: that Petrarch flowed in: Laura to his lady was but a

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: kitchen-wench; marry, she had a better love to

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: be-rhyme her; Dido a dowdy; Cleopatra a gipsy;

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Helen and Hero hildings and harlots; Thisbe a grey

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: eye or so, but not to the purpose. Signior

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Romeo, bon jour! there's a French salutation

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: to your French slop. You gave us the counterfeit

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: fairly last night.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Good morrow to you both. What counterfeit did I give you?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: The ship, sir, the slip; can you not conceive?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Pardon, good Mercutio, my business was great; and in

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: such a case as mine a man may strain courtesy.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: That's as much as to say, such a case as yours

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: constrains a man to bow in the hams.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Meaning, to court'sy.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Thou hast most kindly hit it.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: A most courteous exposition.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Nay, I am the very pink of courtesy.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Pink for flower.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Right.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Why, then is my pump well flowered.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Well said: follow me this jest now till thou hast

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: worn out thy pump, that when the single sole of it

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: is worn, the jest may remain after the wearing sole singular.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: O single-soled jest, solely singular for the

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: singleness.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Come between us, good Benvolio; my wits faint.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Switch and spurs, switch and spurs; or I'll cry a match.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Nay, if thy wits run the wild-goose chase, I have

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: done, for thou hast more of the wild-goose in one of

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: thy wits than, I am sure, I have in my whole five:

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: was I with you there for the goose?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Thou wast never with me for any thing when thou wast

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: not there for the goose.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: I will bite thee by the ear for that jest.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Nay, good goose, bite not.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Thy wit is a very bitter sweeting; it is a most

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: sharp sauce.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And is it not well served in to a sweet goose?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: O here's a wit of cheveril, that stretches from an

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: inch narrow to an ell broad!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I stretch it out for that word 'broad;' which added

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: to the goose, proves thee far and wide a broad goose.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Why, is not this better now than groaning for love?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: now art thou sociable, now art thou Romeo; now art

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: thou what thou art, by art as well as by nature:

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: for this drivelling love is like a great natural,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: that runs lolling up and down to hide his bauble in a hole.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Stop there, stop there.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Thou desirest me to stop in my tale against the hair.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Thou wouldst else have made thy tale large.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: O, thou art deceived; I would have made it short:

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: for I was come to the whole depth of my tale; and

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: meant, indeed, to occupy the argument no longer.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Here's goodly gear!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Enter Nurse and PETER

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: A sail, a sail!

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: Two, two; a shirt and a smock.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Peter!

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Anon!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: My fan, Peter.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Good Peter, to hide her face; for her fan's the

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: fairer face.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: God ye good morrow, gentlemen.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: God ye good den, fair gentlewoman.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Is it good den?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: 'Tis no less, I tell you, for the bawdy hand of the

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: dial is now upon the prick of noon.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Out upon you! what a man are you!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: One, gentlewoman, that God hath made for himself to

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: mar.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: By my troth, it is well said; 'for himself to mar,'

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: quoth a'? Gentlemen, can any of you tell me where I

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: may find the young Romeo?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I can tell you; but young Romeo will be older when

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: you have found him than he was when you sought him:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I am the youngest of that name, for fault of a worse.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: You say well.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Yea, is the worst well? very well took, i' faith;

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: wisely, wisely.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: if you be he, sir, I desire some confidence with

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: you.

speaker: BENVOLIO
text_entry: She will indite him to some supper.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: A bawd, a bawd, a bawd! so ho!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: What hast thou found?

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: No hare, sir; unless a hare, sir, in a lenten pie,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: that is something stale and hoar ere it be spent.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Sings

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: An old hare hoar,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: And an old hare hoar,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Is very good meat in lent

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: But a hare that is hoar

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Is too much for a score,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: When it hoars ere it be spent.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Romeo, will you come to your father's? we'll

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: to dinner, thither.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I will follow you.

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Farewell, ancient lady; farewell,

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Singing

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: 'lady, lady, lady.'

speaker: MERCUTIO
text_entry: Exeunt MERCUTIO and BENVOLIO

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Marry, farewell! I pray you, sir, what saucy

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: merchant was this, that was so full of his ropery?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: A gentleman, nurse, that loves to hear himself talk,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: and will speak more in a minute than he will stand

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: to in a month.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: An a' speak any thing against me, I'll take him

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: down, an a' were lustier than he is, and twenty such

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Jacks; and if I cannot, I'll find those that shall.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Scurvy knave! I am none of his flirt-gills; I am

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: none of his skains-mates. And thou must stand by

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: too, and suffer every knave to use me at his pleasure?

speaker: PETER
text_entry: I saw no man use you a pleasure; if I had, my weapon

speaker: PETER
text_entry: should quickly have been out, I warrant you: I dare

speaker: PETER
text_entry: draw as soon as another man, if I see occasion in a

speaker: PETER
text_entry: good quarrel, and the law on my side.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Now, afore God, I am so vexed, that every part about

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: me quivers. Scurvy knave! Pray you, sir, a word:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: and as I told you, my young lady bade me inquire you

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: out; what she bade me say, I will keep to myself:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: but first let me tell ye, if ye should lead her into

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: a fool's paradise, as they say, it were a very gross

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: kind of behavior, as they say: for the gentlewoman

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: is young; and, therefore, if you should deal double

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: with her, truly it were an ill thing to be offered

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: to any gentlewoman, and very weak dealing.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Nurse, commend me to thy lady and mistress. I

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: protest unto thee--

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Good heart, and, i' faith, I will tell her as much:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Lord, Lord, she will be a joyful woman.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: What wilt thou tell her, nurse? thou dost not mark me.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I will tell her, sir, that you do protest; which, as

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I take it, is a gentlemanlike offer.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Bid her devise

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Some means to come to shrift this afternoon;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And there she shall at Friar Laurence' cell

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Be shrived and married. Here is for thy pains.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: No truly sir; not a penny.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Go to; I say you shall.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: This afternoon, sir? well, she shall be there.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And stay, good nurse, behind the abbey wall:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Within this hour my man shall be with thee

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And bring thee cords made like a tackled stair;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Which to the high top-gallant of my joy

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Must be my convoy in the secret night.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Farewell; be trusty, and I'll quit thy pains:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Farewell; commend me to thy mistress.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Now God in heaven bless thee! Hark you, sir.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: What say'st thou, my dear nurse?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Is your man secret? Did you ne'er hear say,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Two may keep counsel, putting one away?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I warrant thee, my man's as true as steel.

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: Well, sir; my mistress is the sweetest lady--Lord,

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: Lord! when 'twas a little prating thing:--O, there

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: is a nobleman in town, one Paris, that would fain

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: lay knife aboard; but she, good soul, had as lief

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: see a toad, a very toad, as see him. I anger her

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: sometimes and tell her that Paris is the properer

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: man; but, I'll warrant you, when I say so, she looks

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: as pale as any clout in the versal world. Doth not

speaker: NURSE
text_entry: rosemary and Romeo begin both with a letter?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Ay, nurse; what of that? both with an R.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Ah. mocker! that's the dog's name; R is for

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: the--No; I know it begins with some other

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: letter:--and she hath the prettiest sententious of

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: it, of you and rosemary, that it would do you good

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: to hear it.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Commend me to thy lady.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Ay, a thousand times.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exit Romeo

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Peter!

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Anon!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Peter, take my fan, and go before and apace.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exeunt
